text: hello and welcome to community chats i'm
your host ali hammer and today we're
joined with lucy wang
a solution architect who is part of our
aws grad program
so lewis to start off i wanted to ask
you about your incredible achievement of
passing
four aws certification exams during your
internship
that is unheard of for an intern and you
should be so proud of yourself
so can you share with us why you think
it's helpful for students to get aws
certified
if they actually want to land a job here
at aws
thanks for having me back on the show
ali so preparing for an aws
certification
as a student is a great way to learn
about the power of the cloud
and also advance your technical skills i
always get asked by students whether or
not passing a certification exam can
increase their chances of landing a
technical role at aws
and although there's no guarantee that
obtaining a certification can get you a
job
the process of studying for one is
really valuable there's a lot of
structured online courses offered by aws
and they map out a learning pathway for
students to get some hands-on experience
with the services
it can also help you stand out during
the job application process
because having a certification shows
that you have a basic understanding of
the core services that aws offers
as well as how these services can be
used together to solve business and
technical problems
well i myself have taken the cloud
practitioner certification exam so i can
definitely agree that there are huge
benefits
and if you do that in conjunction with
the leadership principles and
you know finding out about that i think
you're in very good hands to
have a good chance at getting an
interview so for anyone watching this
interview who might be interested
how do you get started with aws
certifications and do you need any prior
knowledge or technical experience
so to start off with it would be best to
check out the
different certifications aws offers and
also figure out which one you want to
prepare for based on your interests and
skill level
with that being said though you
definitely don't need to come from a
technical background or have any
previous experience with aws
i would recommend the aws certified
cloud practitioner exam for those who
are just starting out
because it's a great introduction to the
cloud fundamentals and best practices
the next step is to block out some time
in your schedule to focus on preparing
for the exam
and there's lots of resources available
by aws and also externally as well
but if you would like some more support
there are also other programs that offer
instructor-led training so if you're
ready to sit the exam
after preparing for it you can head to
the aws certification website to book
either an in-person or online exam
well there's definitely a lot of options
here at aws and it's so great that
there's so many free resources as well
so finally luce what advice do you have
for students who are considering doing
or might have
actually already started preparing for
an aws certification
i think my biggest piece of advice for
students is to figure out why they want
to get aws certified
you know for some of you it might be
your first time learning about the cloud
and you want to use certifications as a
way to follow a structured learning path
and for others these certifications
might be useful in your current or
future role
and so by studying for them you can
build up your technical skills
whatever the reason is as long as you
know why you want to achieve a
certification
it would make it a lot easier for you to
maintain motivation throughout the whole
process
another tip is to book your exam ahead
of time and that way you can
work backwards to figure out how many
hours a week you need to dedicate to
your learning
and finally try to make the journey as
fun and engaging as possible
you know sometimes it can get quite dry
just reading through pages of notes
so make sure you also spend your time on
video lectures
hands-on labs and also practice
questions
luce i'm really grateful that you're on
the show i mean i've literally never
heard of any intern completing
four aws certifications that is
incredible
we all look up to you so much and i
think you've inspired me to want to
study for my next certification so thank
you so much for all the great tips
and if anyone has any questions please
